policy_draft.objectives: To establish a structured and efficient procurement process that supports Tech Solutions Inc.'s operational needs while ensuring compliance with relevant regulations.
policy_draft.scope: This policy applies to all procurement activities within Tech Solutions Inc., including software licenses, IT hardware, office supplies, and professional services.
policy_draft.procurement_methods: Procurement will be conducted through competitive bidding, direct negotiations, and framework agreements, depending on the category and value of the procurement.
policy_draft.roles_and_responsibilities: The Procurement Manager oversees all procurement activities, Procurement Officers handle day-to-day procurement tasks, and the Administrative Assistant supports documentation and communication.
policy_draft.compliance_measures: All procurement activities must comply with local and international data protection laws, anti-corruption regulations, and environmental sustainability standards.

procedure_development: Step 1: Identify procurement needs based on departmental requests and budget allocations.
Step 2: Develop and issue a Request for Proposal (RFP) or Request for Quotation (RFQ) based on the procurement category.
Step 3: Evaluate received bids using a standardized scoring system that considers price, quality, and vendor reliability.
Step 4: Conduct negotiations with shortlisted vendors to finalize terms and conditions.
Step 5: Award the contract to the selected vendor and ensure all documentation is completed and filed.
Step 6: Monitor the delivery of goods/services and assess vendor performance against contract terms.
Step 7: Conduct a post-procurement review to identify lessons learned and areas for improvement.
